definition: the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
implicit charm in rhyme or sound/hinted appeal/interest
charm or grace (in poetry or art)
to rhyme/sometimes written 壓韻|压韵
pleasant lingering effect/memorable stylishness/haunting tune/aftertaste (of a good wine etc)
music/rhyme and rhythm/initial, 音[yin1], and final and tone, 韻|韵[yun4], of a Chinese character/phoneme
rhyming word ending a line of verse/rhyme
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")

sentences.english: The Quanzhen authentic rhyming is music used by Quanzhen School of Taoism.
sentences.chinese: 全真正韵是道教全真教派使用的音乐。

sentences.english: Clouds were done with a basic airbrush on an additional layer.
sentences.chinese: 在另一个图层上用基本的喷枪绘制韵。

sentences.english: Mings theory on poetic "rhythm" has two points.
sentences.chinese: 明人“韵”论在两个层面上展开。

sentences.english: He knew he wanted the names to be alliterative, much like Luke and Leia.
sentences.chinese: 因为他想使这两个名字压头韵，就像卢克和莱娅那样。

sentences.english: The band consists of singer, piano, large betti, guitar, drums .
sentences.chinese: 韵乐队由女歌手，钢琴，大贝提，吉他，爵士鼓组成。

sentences.english: Quanzhen Taoism Zhengyun is the songbook of Quanzhen Taoism.
sentences.chinese: 《全真正韵》是道教全真派的歌曲集。

sentences.english: The second sentence must rhyme with the fourth.
sentences.chinese: 上句辙韵自由，下句必须押韵。

sentences.english: The Pearl River is where Guangzhou's scenic spots are.
sentences.chinese: 珠水夜韵是指珠江夜景。

sentences.english: Very caressing in the mouth, balanced and ends with a long aftertaste of tobacco smokiness .
sentences.chinese: 舌头被这酒轻抚著，平衡得来并带著长长的烟丝馀韵。

sentences.english: Melody refer to the voice of the original cadence, is a spiritual experience.
sentences.chinese: 韵原来是指声音的抑扬顿挫，是一种心灵的感受。

sentences.english: The elegance of the ancient music condenses into the deep national complex;
sentences.chinese: 诗文古乐的馨雅致韵，凝结成铿锵悠远的民族情节。

sentences.english: Who is the flute rhyme where casually daub.
sentences.chinese: 谁散了笛声韵在那里胡乱地涂抹。

sentences.english: They must each compose a poem in strict alliterative metre.
sentences.chinese: 他们必须每人作一首严格押头韵的诗。

sentences.english: It originated in Nan Dynasty and a complete system was formed in Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 马蹄韵发端于南朝，到清代才形成一个完整的系统。

sentences.english: Give me an order of chicken curry.
They must each compose a poem in strict alliterative metre .
sentences.chinese: 他们必须每人作一首严格押头韵的诗。

definition: to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)
level and oblique tones (technical term for Classical Chinese rhythmic poetry)
to nip/to grasp with the fingers/to fiddle with/Taiwan pr. [nian2]
to accumulate/to hold in store/to contain/to gather together/to collect/depth/inner strength/profundity
to write a poem using another poem's rhymes
a beautiful woman/graceful and elegant posture/moon
(literary) to end/to stop/one of the stanzas (usually two) of a ci poem 詞|词[ci2]/classifier for songs or ci poems
your kind offer/your valued advice/delicate interest and charm
